notes:
Domestic student. Higher grades from Master's in different domestic school (GPA from undergrad). No interviews in past 4 months (I initialized short email conversation in November).
Asked by email, they said plan was to finalize acceptance decisions by April 11 (delayed from March 15, then April 1). Good luck all!
didn't bother to send an email, just checked the portal to see that I was denied. No interview.
No email has been sent yet but checked the status on Quest. Applied for both computer science and Institute for Quantum Computing (both Ph.D.), got rejected for both. Good luck everyone!

Anybody got any updates about waterloo? anyone? Hey, yo? You got an update? Hello... anyone ?? Please.... somebody save me from dying in mental hell... Hellooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo, Helppppppppppppppppppppppppppp

Randomly checked the website. Denied admission
Check application portable and was denied
Not Waitlist. Does anyone know when UWaterloo will start releasing their results for PhD? Thanks!
TTPB: Did your POI tell you when to expect the official acceptance letter on Quest?

TTPB: Received the same email. Had an interview back in November. Not sure about what this means too. But I guess either an offer will come soon or they want to find out whether you will accept the offer before they give one. I'm trying to contact them about what's going on.
"Deny" on the website. Didn't get an email notification.

Rejected. Found it on Quest (no email notification). Had 77% undergrad and 85% MSc average. My MSc thesis deals quantum information (quantum error correction codes) and I taught myself the entire branch of quantum computing in a few months (which were hectic). Didn't publish any papers (which is the only negative aspect in my opinion). Nonetheless, best of luck to all of you!
Status changed to "Admit" on QUEST without email notification, and no offer letter is provided yet.

I'm waiting for a decision. My future professor informally let me know almost acceptance in a few weeks ago, but Quest doesn't still show the result. I feel a little bit nervous about the final decision (and school life) in this pandemic situation.
Informally accepted much earlier this month.  Skype interview, visiting the school in the next few weeks.  ML/Theory focus.
Status changed to 'Deny' on online portal (Quest). No notifications. Sad.
Its May 2 and Waterloo hasn't given a yes or no on both of my applications. Need to know very soon. Would otherwise have to go somewhere else.

Saw it on the application portal. Disappointed, but glad to have closure on this year's applications. Congrats to everyone who got in! And thanks to everyone for the comments and good advice. It will help for future applications.

To the frustrated poster below - I am still waiting to hear the official word from Waterloo. I have applied for other Engineering branch, not CS. Their Engineering page says  decisions will be sent out 8-10 weeks from application deadline. Mine was Feb 1 so this upcoming week will be the 10th week. Hopefully, they'll release their decisions out this week.  Hope this helps.
Official acceptance letter.

Had a matching interest with the potential advisor and good research experience with one international and one national publication. 9/10 GPA, Amongst top in class both undergrad and Top 5 in Grad. 1 Good LoR, 2 average LoR. A bit off on AWA section of GRE but I think I made up for that while interviewing with the potential supervisor.
Informal offer by PoI.
Had an interview about two hours ago.
Had an interview just an hour ago.
They took really long for rejection. 5 years experience of both industry and academics. TOEFL 100. Good LORs. 1 IEEE paper publication as an FYP supervisor.
Website updated, no feedback from UoW or anything, glad I'm going elsewhere.
Still waiting on to hear anything, email no response.
one Publication in international conference and one journal.
Canadian undergrad/masters.
Emailed by professor a week ago that I was being accepted. Recieved offer today.
No paper, one US patent application. A prof emailed me to join his lab, I'm so hyped after 6 other rejections.
Informally via email.  A few publications.  M.S in CS and M.S. in Math.
Unofficial acceptance from prof
10 years of work experience, Physical sciences undergrad, great LoRs.
